page.title: 16Housing
page.content: Fareham town remained a small provincial town until the nineteen fifties primarily because it was hemmed in by large private landowners. The main three were forced by death duties in the early fifties to sell some of their land.This was bought by builders and the town has more than doubled in size since that time. A housing map of the town would show three distinct sections. The oldest section would be the town itself.Then in the early nineteen hundreds large council housing estates were built to the south of the town.Since nineteen fifty the town has expanded to the north ,west and east.Green belt land has kept building within certain bounds,the M27 being the northern boundary at the moment.
